column5: Quick question....  I need a charger for my small 12v battery for my humminbird portable pack...  How high of amps is safe for a battery like this...?  I found a 1 amp battery tender junior but it's $40... If I'm gunna spend that I might as well get a car charger with a 2a setting... But is that too high of amps for  these batteries...???  Thanks  Mike
get the one amp  the 2 amp might work well but sometimes the higher amp chargers don't see the  small batteries as needing a charge until they are really low
I've been using my smart deep cycle battery charger on the 2A setting for about 5 or 6 years now on my gel battery. It works fine.  S.
yeah so work great others don't like small batteries
In use a standard battery charger with a 2A setting, no problems.

Most batteries don't like being charged at more than C10, that being 10% of capacity.  Therefore, as most portable packs are run from 7 Amp batteries. they shouldn't be charged at more than .7 Amps or 700mA.  Get the right charger for the job.
I use a Battery Tender Jr for all my small 12V batteries.
Another very good one is the Tecmate Optimate 4. I bought mine at Magnacharge when I picked up the bigger 15 A battery packs.

Most batteries don't like being charged at more than C10, that being 10% of capacity.  Therefore, as most portable packs are run from 7 Amp batteries. they shouldn't be charged at more than .7 Amps or 700mA.  Get the right charger for the job.   yup
I picked up a Noco genius G750 smart charger...  $42.99...  750ma
